ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: The 3D Realtime Surface Mesh example shows how to update a Uniform Mesh in real-time
ExampleDefinition.Description:
This example mixes the 2D [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.SciChartSurface.html']SciChartSurface[/url] and DirectX powered 3D [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.SciChart3DSurface.html']SciChart3DSurface[/url] to render a real-time spectrogram / scrolling heatmap next to scrolling line charts.
Scrolling Line Series are provided by the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Model.DataSeries.XyDataSeries%602.html']XyDataSeries[/url] with FifoCapacity set to enable First-In-First-Out scrolling.
Scrolling heatmaps are provided by the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Model.UniformGridDataSeries3D%603.html']UniformGridDataSeries3D[/url] and [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.RenderableSeries.SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D.html']SurfaceMeshRenderableSeries3D[/url], which provides an interface to [b]PushRow[/b] - to scroll rows of the uniform grid, giving a scrolling heatmap effect.
Finally, the [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.SciChart3DSurface~Camera.html']SciChart3DSurface.Camera[/url] is set to an orthogonal [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting3D~SciChart.Charting3D.Camera3D.html']Camera[/url] looking down on the scene from above to give the impression of a 2D chart.
